intro: Oxypetalum stipatum, commonly known as the stippled oxypetalum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a distinctive stipitate base, giving it its scientific name. The flowers are often white or pale pink, and they bloom during the warmer months of the year.
